results.title: The Shape of quality
results.brief_description: A film for VW car lovers. All aspects of the production of the Volkswagen Beetle, manufactured in the Australian plant in Clayton, Melbourne. The manufacture and assembly of the many parts of the motor is shown, including pattern and tool making and the press shop, moulding of parts, the addition of mudguards and doors and the painting of the bodywork. We see the chassis assembled and joined with the engine, then these joined with the bodywork before finishing touches are made. Car trials and suburban and rural driving conditions demonstrate the reliability and performance of the car.

results.title: The Shape of plastics
results.creator_credit: Alan Pendry, Michael Clarke and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Shows the role of research chemist in the formulation of new polymers; takes a quick look at plastic production in the processing plants, and dazzles the viewer with colourful examples of the varied consumer goods. Bronze Medal, Barcelona, 1963; Gold medal, Bilboa, 1963.

results.title: Shakespeare and his stage: Approaches to Hamlet
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities
results.brief_description: This film is narrated by Sir John Gielgud, and was photographed in England on a stage reconstructed in an Elizabethan courtyard. It concentrates mainly on the staging and interpretation of Hamlet. Includes interpretations of Hamlet by such actors as Laurence Olivier, Nicol Williamson, John Barrymore and John Gielgud. Provides background information on Shakespeare and the Elizabethan period.

results.title: Shakespeare: A Mirror to man
results.creator_credit: Ian Brims, Helen Jean Secondari, John H. Secondari and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Englsih actors Eileen Atkins and Brian Cox use a Tudor castle as the setting for this introduction to Shakespeare. Playing all the roles in segments from three of his plays, then stepping out of character to explain, analyse and question, they reveal the essence of Shakespeare’s genius - and his remarkable understanding of the deepest motivations and darkest emotions of man.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Brims, Helen Jean Secondari, John H. Secondari and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: The Shah of Iran's visit to Australia 1974
results.brief_description: Official greeting by the Governor General Sir William Kerr, the Prime Minister and Mrs Whitlam, as well as senior parliamentarians and leading members of the diplomatic corps, mark the beginning of a busy week of engagemnets for the Royal couple through the Eatern states of Australia.

results.title: Seven o'clock news
results.brief_description: Shows an ABC radio announcer preparing the script of the 7 o’clock news for transmission over the ABC network. A recruiting film illustrating many aspects of the work of the the PMG Department, including the provision of communications systems for radi broadcasting and the training of Post Office personnel as telegraphists, postal clerks and technicians.

results.title: Semi-conductors. Part I. Diodes and triodes
results.brief_description: The basic physics and theory of hole and electron flow in semi-conductor material as related to the P.N. junction. Basic transistor or triode operating characteristics show how and why it is an amplifying device.
